channel.title: MySQL/PersistenceAuth - Client hangs
channel.description:
I've been trying to set up the Moparscape Classic pre-beta server with JDK7 on a dedicated server. I've searched through all the forum posts which have been a great help so far, however have run into an issue and would greatly appreciate any help.
The config.xml is using MySQL as the storage medium and PersistenceAuth for authentication. Apache is set up, localhost/auth.php works, mysql is set up, and everything imported, and it seems communication is taking place, however whenever I attempt to login with the correct username/password, it will hang on "Please wait... connecting to server" for about one minute, before then timing out. If I try to login again, it says that player is already logged in.
This doesn't occur when using DummyStorage, so I don't think it's a client issue. From following the forum posts here, I've set up the mysql db so that the "user" field under the pk_players table is the long version of the username, 'username' is the actual username, and 'pass' is md5 encrypted. Both owner and owner_username are NULL since I'm not using a forum for authentication.
The database is clearly communicating with the ls/gs since the value within 'online' is changed from 0 to 1 after I attempt the login. So it's cearly logging in with the correct password on the server end, but for whatever reason the client isn't logging in and displaying the game world (all this is done from the same machine).
Following errors come up on the login server whilst it's running - [code] [java] No config file specified. [java] Defaulting to use conf/Config.xml [java] Login Server starting up... [java] Storage Medium: MySQL [java] Authentication Scheme: PersistenceAuth [java] LoginEngine now running [java] Registering world: 1 [java] Class: You must enter both a username and a password - Please try again Player: Test [java] java.sql.SQLException: Illegal operation on empty result set. [java] at com.mysql.jdbc.ResultSet.checkRowPos(ResultSet.java:680) [java] at com.mysql.jdbc.ResultSet.getNativeInt(ResultSet.java:7605) [java] at com.mysql.jdbc.ResultSet.getNativeInt(ResultSet.java:7601) [java] at com.mysql.jdbc.ResultSet.getInt(ResultSet.java:2492) [java] at com.mysql.jdbc.ResultSet.getInt(ResultSet.java:2507) [java] at org.moparscape.msc.ls.persistence.impl.MySQL.intArrayFromStringArray(MySQL.java:544) [java] at org.moparscape.msc.ls.persistence.impl.MySQL.loadPlayer(MySQL.java:444) [java] at org.moparscape.msc.ls.model.PlayerSave.loadPlayer(PlayerSave.java:16) [java] at org.moparscape.msc.ls.Server.findSave(Server.java:133) [java] at org.moparscape.msc.ls.packethandler.loginserver.PlayerLoginHandler.handlePacket(PlayerLoginHandler.java:52) [java] at org.moparscape.msc.ls.LoginEngine.processIncomingPackets(LoginEngine.java:106) [java] at org.moparscape.msc.ls.LoginEngine.run(LoginEngine.java:146) [java] java.sql.SQLException: Illegal operation on empty result set. [java] at com.mysql.jdbc.ResultSet.checkRowPos(ResultSet.java:680) [java] at com.mysql.jdbc.ResultSet.getNativeInt(ResultSet.java:7605) [java] at com.mysql.jdbc.ResultSet.getNativeInt(ResultSet.java:7601) [java] at com.mysql.jdbc.ResultSet.getInt(ResultSet.java:2492) [java] at com.mysql.jdbc.ResultSet.getInt(ResultSet.java:2507) [java] at org.moparscape.msc.ls.persistence.impl.MySQL.intArrayFromStringArray(MySQL.java:544) [java] at org.moparscape.msc.ls.persistence.impl.MySQL.loadPlayer(MySQL.java:446) [java] at org.moparscape.msc.ls.model.PlayerSave.loadPlayer(PlayerSave.java:16) [java] at org.moparscape.msc.ls.Server.findSave(Server.java:133) [java] at org.moparscape.msc.ls.packethandler.loginserver.PlayerLoginHandler.handlePacket(PlayerLoginHandler.java:52) [java] at org.moparscape.msc.ls.LoginEngine.processIncomingPackets(LoginEngine.java:106) [java] at org.moparscape.msc.ls.LoginEngine.run(LoginEngine.java:146) [java] Added Test to world 1 [java] java.lang.NullPointerException [java] at org.moparscape.msc.ls.model.PlayerSave.getExp(PlayerSave.java:134) [java] at org.moparscape.msc.ls.packetbuilder.loginserver.PlayerLoginPacketBuilder.getPacket(PlayerLoginPacketBuilder.java:69) [java] at org.moparscape.msc.ls.packethandler.loginserver.PlayerLoginHandler.handlePacket(PlayerLoginHandler.java:59) [java] at org.moparscape.msc.ls.LoginEngine.processIncomingPackets(LoginEngine.java:106) [java] at org.moparscape.msc.ls.LoginEngine.run(LoginEngine.java:146) [/code]

get a Java textbook
[/quote]

Read all the basics online as the cheap beginner books are a waste of money unless you get them from a local library. After you got the basics get something more advanced.
http://www.amazon.com/[/quote]He wanted exercises, and the ones I’ve seen in normal Java books don’t do it.

Also, there are tons of books that cover “advanced” topics that use Java to teach the concepts.

i have knowledge of java i just stopped caring about it(just a few basics and looking at sources to find my way around). I have ran a couple servers that didn’t do to bad… they weren’t great but they were up.

i wish i could run a server because it would b the dope around this place. I just am not great with java
[/quote]

Not trying to gang up on you, but your statement contradicts itself.

Not that great with java and being dope at running a server shouldn’t be in the same sentence/paragraph.

Just do the oracle java lessons. They are pretty simple and have a ton of useful info you need to know to be able to attempt programming in Java.[/quote]They’re a start, but nowhere near enough…

item.title: MySQL/PersistenceAuth - Client hangs
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

[quote=“Crooks, post:11, topic:518734”]Just do what I did when I worked with Roderwilco on a server based of moparclassic a few months ago, I will paste it here since people seem to be mad at you for filling the whole help section.

LoginServer\src\org\moparscape\msc\ls\persistence\impl\MySQL

put at the bottom of the class or anywhere you want…

	@Override
	public boolean validatePassword(long userHash, String passwordHash) {
		ResultSet result = resultSetFromLongs(Statements.playerData, userHash);
		try {
			if (!result.next()) {
				return false;
			}
			String databaseHash = result.getString("pass");

			if(passwordHash.equals(databaseHash)) {
				return true;
			}	
		} catch (SQLException e) {
			e.printStackTrace();
		}
		return false;
	}

under, private static final String logIn = “UPDATE pk_players SET login_date=?, login_ip=? WHERE user=?”; in same class add.

private static final String passwordHash = "SELECT FROM * `"+ PREFIX + "players` WHERE `user`=?";

LoginServer\src\org\moparscape\msc\ls\persistence\StorageMedium at the bottom of the file add

boolean validatePassword(long userHash, String passwordHash);

LoginServer\src\org\moparscape\msc\ls\packethandler\loginserver under

if (!Server.storage.playerExists(user))
return 2;

if (!Server.storage.validatePassword(user, pass)) {
return 2;
}

Good luck, there might be something missing, but i’m sure you can figure that out.

EDIT: This was actually to Matty matt and others who ask bout the MySQL thaang, I posted it in the wrong thread though was going to post it in one of Matty matts threads, whatever…[/quote]This is exactly what you shouldn’t be doing… There is an entire system set up to deal with authenticating users. Use it, don’t completely butcher the systems just because you don’t understand them.

Read full topic

item.title: MySQL/PersistenceAuth - Client hangs
item.dc:creator: @Crooks Crooks
item.description:
@Crooks wrote:

Make sure the config use;

<entry key="storage-medium">org.moparscape.msc.ls.persistence.impl.MySQL</entry>

Also in GameServer\src\org\moparscape\msc\gs\builders\ls\MiscPacketBuilder replace your playerlogin packet with

	public void playerLogin(Player player) {
		LSPacketBuilder s = new LSPacketBuilder();
		s.setID(31);
		s.setHandler(connector, new PlayerLogin(player));
		s.addLong(player.getUsernameHash());
		s.addLong(DataConversions.IPToLong(player.getCurrentIP()));
		s.addBytes(DataConversions.md5(player.getPassword()).getBytes());
		s.addBytes(player.getClassName().getBytes());
		packets.add(s.toPacket());
	}

Read full topic

item.description:
@Crooks wrote:

Just do what I did when I worked with Roderwilco on a server based of moparclassic a few months ago, I will paste it here since people seem to be mad at you for filling the whole help section.

LoginServer\src\org\moparscape\msc\ls\persistence\impl\MySQL

put at the bottom of the class or anywhere you want…

	@Override
	public boolean validatePassword(long userHash, String passwordHash) {
		ResultSet result = resultSetFromLongs(Statements.playerData, userHash);
		try {
			if (!result.next()) {
				return false;
			}
			String databaseHash = result.getString("pass");

			if(passwordHash.equals(databaseHash)) {
				return true;
			}	
		} catch (SQLException e) {
			e.printStackTrace();
		}
		return false;
	}

under, private static final String logIn = “UPDATE pk_players SET login_date=?, login_ip=? WHERE user=?”; in same class add.

private static final String passwordHash = "SELECT FROM * `"+ PREFIX + "players` WHERE `user`=?";

LoginServer\src\org\moparscape\msc\ls\persistence\StorageMedium at the bottom of the file add

boolean validatePassword(long userHash, String passwordHash);

LoginServer\src\org\moparscape\msc\ls\packethandler\loginserver under

if (!Server.storage.playerExists(user))
return 2;

if (!Server.storage.validatePassword(user, pass)) {
return 2;
}

Good luck, there might be something missing, but i’m sure you can figure that out.

EDIT: This was actually to Matty matt and others who ask bout the MySQL thaang, I posted it in the wrong thread though was going to post it in one of Matty matts threads, whatever…

item.title: MySQL/PersistenceAuth - Client hangs
item.dc:creator: @matty_matt matty matt
item.description:
@matty_matt wrote:

[quote=“blueillusion, post:1, topic:518734”]I’ve been trying to set up the Moparscape Classic pre-beta server with JDK7 on a dedicated server. I’ve searched through all the forum posts which have been a great help so far, however have run into an issue and would greatly appreciate any help.

The config.xml is using MySQL as the storage medium and PersistenceAuth for authentication. Apache is set up, localhost/auth.php works, mysql is set up, and everything imported, and it seems communication is taking place, however whenever I attempt to login with the correct username/password, it will hang on “Please wait… connecting to server” for about one minute, before then timing out. If I try to login again, it says that player is already logged in.

This doesn’t occur when using DummyStorage, so I don’t think it’s a client issue. From following the forum posts here, I’ve set up the mysql db so that the “user” field under the pk_players table is the long version of the username, ‘username’ is the actual username, and ‘pass’ is md5 encrypted. Both owner and owner_username are NULL since I’m not using a forum for authentication.

The database is clearly communicating with the ls/gs since the value within ‘online’ is changed from 0 to 1 after I attempt the login. So it’s cearly logging in with the correct password on the server end, but for whatever reason the client isn’t logging in and displaying the game world (all this is done from the same machine).

Following errors come up on the login server whilst it’s running - [java] No config file specified. [java] Defaulting to use conf/Config.xml [java] Login Server starting up... [java] Storage Medium: MySQL [java] Authentication Scheme: PersistenceAuth [java] LoginEngine now running [java] Registering world: 1 [java] Class: You must enter both a username and a password - Please try again Player: Test [java] java.sql.SQLException: Illegal operation on empty result set. [java] at com.mysql.jdbc.ResultSet.checkRowPos(ResultSet.java:680) [java] at com.mysql.jdbc.ResultSet.getNativeInt(ResultSet.java:7605) [java] at com.mysql.jdbc.ResultSet.getNativeInt(ResultSet.java:7601) [java] at com.mysql.jdbc.ResultSet.getInt(ResultSet.java:2492) [java] at com.mysql.jdbc.ResultSet.getInt(ResultSet.java:2507) [java] at org.moparscape.msc.ls.persistence.impl.MySQL.intArrayFromStringArray(MySQL.java:544) [java] at org.moparscape.msc.ls.persistence.impl.MySQL.loadPlayer(MySQL.java:444) [java] at org.moparscape.msc.ls.model.PlayerSave.loadPlayer(PlayerSave.java:16) [java] at org.moparscape.msc.ls.Server.findSave(Server.java:133) [java] at org.moparscape.msc.ls.packethandler.loginserver.PlayerLoginHandler.handlePacket(PlayerLoginHandler.java:52) [java] at org.moparscape.msc.ls.LoginEngine.processIncomingPackets(LoginEngine.java:106) [java] at org.moparscape.msc.ls.LoginEngine.run(LoginEngine.java:146) [java] java.sql.SQLException: Illegal operation on empty result set. [java] at com.mysql.jdbc.ResultSet.checkRowPos(ResultSet.java:680) [java] at com.mysql.jdbc.ResultSet.getNativeInt(ResultSet.java:7605) [java] at com.mysql.jdbc.ResultSet.getNativeInt(ResultSet.java:7601) [java] at com.mysql.jdbc.ResultSet.getInt(ResultSet.java:2492) [java] at com.mysql.jdbc.ResultSet.getInt(ResultSet.java:2507) [java] at org.moparscape.msc.ls.persistence.impl.MySQL.intArrayFromStringArray(MySQL.java:544) [java] at org.moparscape.msc.ls.persistence.impl.MySQL.loadPlayer(MySQL.java:446) [java] at org.moparscape.msc.ls.model.PlayerSave.loadPlayer(PlayerSave.java:16) [java] at org.moparscape.msc.ls.Server.findSave(Server.java:133) [java] at org.moparscape.msc.ls.packethandler.loginserver.PlayerLoginHandler.handlePacket(PlayerLoginHandler.java:52) [java] at org.moparscape.msc.ls.LoginEngine.processIncomingPackets(LoginEngine.java:106) [java] at org.moparscape.msc.ls.LoginEngine.run(LoginEngine.java:146) [java] Added Test to world 1 [java] java.lang.NullPointerException [java] at org.moparscape.msc.ls.model.PlayerSave.getExp(PlayerSave.java:134) [java] at org.moparscape.msc.ls.packetbuilder.loginserver.PlayerLoginPacketBuilder.getPacket(PlayerLoginPacketBuilder.java:69) [java] at org.moparscape.msc.ls.packethandler.loginserver.PlayerLoginHandler.handlePacket(PlayerLoginHandler.java:59) [java] at org.moparscape.msc.ls.LoginEngine.processIncomingPackets(LoginEngine.java:106) [java] at org.moparscape.msc.ls.LoginEngine.run(LoginEngine.java:146) [/quote]
What does it mean if in the login erver command prompt i dont see anything when i try to log into the client…

item.title: MySQL/PersistenceAuth - Client hangs
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

[quote=“blueillusion, post:7, topic:518734”]I’m afraid I don’t have much experience in this. I thought you needed to use mySQL for the persistenceAuth, but seems not. Not really too sure how it works.[/quote]The storage medium and auth don’t need to have any specific combinations… They’re completely independent of one anther.
